oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling and ring-closing metathesis: A strategic combination for the synthesis of cyclophane derivatives
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
MANDAL, K
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: allylic acetate isomerization
imido alkylidene complexes
diels-alder reaction
olefin-metathesis
organic-synthesis
ruthenium benzylidenes
claisen rearrangement
arylboronic acids
grubbs catalyst
aryl
cyclophanes
isomerization
olefin metathesis
palladium
ruthenium
suzuki-miyaura cross-coupling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The synthesis of cyclophane derivatives through a sequence involving Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling between alpha,alpha'-dibromo-m-xylene and arylboronic acid derivatives, alkenylation and ring-closing metathesis has been achieved. One of the cyclophanes was obtained by tandem isomerization and metathesis. Significant magnetic anisotropic effects on the intra-annular hydrogen atoms were observed.
